duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform preventative maintenance and minor repairs on various types of fleet vehicles to ensure safety and reliability for customers.
Utilize tools and technologies for logging, researching, and completing repairs, including basic vehicle diagnostics.
Conduct preventative maintenance repairs, replacement of vehicle components, electrical system repairs, and cooling system maintenance on gas and diesel engine vehicles.
Collaborate with supervisors to learn new skills, receive hands-on coaching, and participate in Penske’s technician training program.
Work on assigned projects and tasks under the guidance of a supervisor.
Adhere to specific instructions, guidelines, rules, regulations, and safety policies established by Penske management and regulatory authorities.
Ensure regular, predictable, full attendance and willingness to work the required schedule and location.
Perform work in a state of alertness and in a safe manner, accepting responsibility for personal safety and the safety of others.
Meet the physical and mental demands of the role, including routine and daily use of hands, ability to work at heights, and lift/move heavy objects safely.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent preferred; vocational or technical certification in vehicle repair preferred
